title: Cullen number
summary: In mathematics, a Cullen number is a member of the integer sequence C n = n â‹… 2 n + 1 {\displaystyle C_{n}=n\cdot 2^{n}+1} (where n {\displaystyle n} is a natural number). Cullen numbers were first studied by James Cullen in 1905. The numbers are special cases of Proth numbers.
